guide.introduction: This is an easy build that will give you a steady mount for your smartphone for filming or taking photographs.
guide.introduction_rendered:
This is an easy build that will give you a steady mount for your smartphone for filming or taking photographs.

Relevant parts
  • 2 * 70mm M5 bolt
  • 8 * M5 nut
  • 2 * 70mm * 10mm * 2mm aluminium bar
  • 2 * suction cup (I used suction cup hooks and removed the hook parts).
  • 1 * Ikea Tertial lamp
Tools
  • Drill or drill press, 5mm and 3.5 mm drill bits
  • Flathead screwdriver
  • Pliers

parts.text: 2 * suction cup (I used suction cup hooks and removed the hook parts).

lines.text: Drill two 5mm holes about 10mm in from each end of the aluminium bars.
lines.text_raw: Drill two 5mm holes about 10mm in from each end of the aluminium bars.

lines.text: In one of the bars, drill two 3.5mm holes to match the lamp mount.
lines.text_raw: In one of the bars, drill two 3.5mm holes to match the lamp mount.

lines.text: Remove the wire and the whole lamp assembly from the lamp. Retain the bolts that attach the mount to the lamp head.
lines.text_raw: Remove the wire and the whole lamp assembly from the lamp. Retain the bolts that attach the mount to the lamp head.

lines.text: Using pliers, slightly bend the mount so the bolt holes are flat.
lines.text_raw: Using pliers, slightly bend the mount so the bolt holes are flat.

lines.text: Using the saved lamp bolts, bolt the 4-hole piece of aluminium bar to the lamp.
lines.text_raw: Using the saved lamp bolts, bolt the 4-hole piece of aluminium bar to the lamp.

lines.text: Bolt the suction cups to the 2-hole piece of aluminium bar with the 70mm bolts and 4 nuts.
lines.text_raw: Bolt the suction cups to the 2-hole piece of aluminium bar with the 70mm bolts and 4 nuts.

lines.text: Using 4 more nuts, bolt the suction cup part to the lamp mount, and you're all done!
lines.text_raw: Using 4 more nuts, bolt the suction cup part to the lamp mount, and you're all done!

lines.text: Enjoy your new steady filming! This also works really well for mounting the iPhone as a video podcast camera.
lines.text_raw: Enjoy your new steady filming! This also works really well for mounting the iPhone as a video podcast camera.
